sentence.text: It is absolutely appalling .
Conditions in Evin have been so appalling that three women prisoners committed suicide in December .
Several witnesses said driving conditions were appalling on the night of the accident .
So appalling was their treatment that one , Mary Clifford , died of her wounds and Elizabeth Brownrigg was deservedly condemned to death .
However , the August fishing became so appalling that my companion and I decided to try a week in May .
A far broader question needs to be asked : Do we need this incredible amount of money spent on a minority culture when television in Scotland is so appalling in the first place ?
Roger Poole , union chief negotiatior , described Mr Clarke 's letter as ` totally and utterly appalling " .
He then showed her with great pride some utterly appalling objects which were used to persuade customers to buy their products .
And Deviation 's ` Hammond Song " reminds one of the music they have in those appalling films about surfing that go on for ever , except with a dance beat .
Are they the people who gave such appalling advice about Hampshire Bus and other segments of the National Bus Company ?
The pay is usually appalling for those who do n't speak much of any language but their own and want cash in hand with few questions asked .
The last few weeks , indeed the last year , had been appalling for Britain , and as Churchill said -- ad nauseam , in Erica 's view -- Britain stood alone .
He spent the next 40 minutes telling MPs how he plans to reverse the appalling situation .
For others , the delay was due to the appalling state of Spanish railways .
The appalling summer weather meant Duncan had more to cope with than he bargained for -- cold water , a swollen river and a lot of fallen branches , leaves and other debris .
The rescue of two skin divers in appalling weather conditions has won Acting Coxswain James Dougal a Silver Medal for Gallantry .
Just over one hundred children came to the Christmas Party that was held on Saturday 16th December , on a day remembered for its appalling weather .
Needless to say , Liverpool are aiming to better their first round performance in appalling weather when their side was reduced to 10 men and went down 4-2 .
Chop logic , if you ask me , " began the pathologist , with a broad grin at his appalling pun .
He was desperate to escape this appalling interview .
These youngsters work seventy metres below ground in appalling conditions .
It was n't a bad meal , but it was a rip-off and the service was appalling .
When it came to practice , the weather was appalling , with low clouds streaming in from the sea and rain falling constantly .
Their defence was appalling .
